Posts.EditableText:
I'm getting a bit fed up with CodePlex - their SVN is buggy, and they seem to have stopped responding to my emails lately. I did request migrating from SVN to Mercurial, but that request has still not been fulfilled.

So I'm thinking of moving over to Github, which seems to be the most popular open-source site at the moment. I'm learning all about how to use Git now, having not used it before. Fun fun...

Posts.EditableText: I've done an initial push to Github, including all the existing SVN history. It turns out that it's not just CodePlex's SVN implementation that has trouble with Unicode filenames, ho hum. So you can grab the code here: https://github.com/alexwarren/Quest This is still experimental at the moment, so the official code repository is still CodePlex for the moment. It should be straightforward for me to keep the github code updated with anything checked in to CodePlex, so the two can run side by side until I decide whether to switch over or not.
